job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Small hospital. Feeling of family oriented hospital.
cons: Due to small hospital, they have minimal resources.

pros: Great step into bedside experience Great teamwork and support
cons: Minimum resources Unorganized Little room for growth

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Alhambra, CA
pros: Small hospital with great staff Family like working environment
Good pay, Friendly Staff, Town was Small

review_title: Lower pay compared to other hospitals but staff are willing to help & support each other.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Helpful coworkers, friendly environment, they try to make sure there are enough CNAs staffed
cons: Some staff are incompetent, charge nurse can be unhelpful at times (depends on which one), administration does not seem to care about employees (no hazard pay), supplies sometimes run out during the shift, computerized charting but still have paper charting to sign, high turnover rate for nurses, administration places doctors on a pedestal (whenever doctors do not adhere to certain policies admin places the responsibility on nurses to get it done)

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
cons: small hospital, so not enough opportunities to grow

review_title: Its Nice Hospital for Gaining Experience
pros:
Its a medium size hospital. Which makes learning what department is where very easy.

There are some great people working there. 

Amazing health care benefits. We pay ZERO for our medical.
cons:
My position tends to be isolating. Which means I only know about 5% and don't seem to care to interact with me.

The hospital feels retro. There is a 1960s feel to the place. It could use being remodeled but I'm sure that would.be way to expensive.

pros: Small hospital, Good place to learn as new grad, mentors and co workers are quite friendly. Good price at cafeteria.
cons: Lower end to the pay scale in comparison to the market, high workload, poor communication with doctors. Only snacks and drinks available via vendor machine between cafeteria closing hours. Free coffee.

pros: Professional and easy to get along with staff. Always a pleasure to go to work and work with motivated people.
cons: There are no cons as I love this hospital but need more hours which is why I am applying. Love being productive.

job_title: Assistant Property Manager in Walnut Creek, CA
pros: flexible...easy going.  good group of people.
cons: They don't provide any structured training..it's guessing and learning as you go.

pros: Nice co workers and friendly people

cons: Salary is way back to other hospital

Extremely Low pay. 
CEO/management doesn't care about the employees. 
Too many poor staff who killing work time.
